name: smuggled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
smuggle
C2 to take things or people to or from a place secretly and often illegally: She was caught trying to smuggle 26 kilos of heroin out of/into the country. They managed to smuggle a video of the captive journalists out of the prison.
More examplesFewer examplesAll four men deny trying to smuggle drugs.There are severe penalties for smuggling guns into the country.Four more Britons were jailed in France yesterday for trying to smuggle illegal immigrants into England.Together they plotted to smuggle weapons into the troubled region.They pleaded guilty to trying to smuggle $8 million worth of marijuana.
